commodities.name: bronze
commodities.description: golden-brown with a smooth, weathered finish, a blend of copper and tin; durable and used in traditional weaponry.

commodities.name: electrum
commodities.description: pale gold with subtle silver tones, highly valued for coinage and jewelry, symbolizing wealth.

commodities.name: steel
commodities.description: silvery-gray and polished with a hint of bluish hue, strong and versatile, the backbone of armor and weaponry.

commodities.name: telstang
commodities.description: semi-transparent bluish-green alloy infused with elemental essence, amplifying air and water magics.

commodities.name: barley
commodities.description: similar to wheat, used in bread, porridge, and brewing.

commodities.name: corn
commodities.description: tall stalks with yellow kernels; eaten fresh or dried.

commodities.name: rice
commodities.description: tiny, white grains harvested from grass-like stalks; a staple in many regions.

commodities.name: wheat
commodities.description: golden heads of grain, ground into flour for bread and pastries.

commodities.name: agate
commodities.description: banded with earthy colors, often semi-translucent with layers of white, brown, and green; prized for decorative carvings.

commodities.name: amber
commodities.description: golden, sometimes with fossilized inclusions, valued for its warmth and magical associations with preservation.

commodities.name: amethyst
commodities.description: purple, transparent, and often faceted, symbolizing calm and clarity, used in magical wards.

commodities.name: aquamarine
commodities.description: light blue, transparent, with a clear shine; used in divination and water magic.

commodities.name: azurite
commodities.description: deep, rich blue with occasional light striations, symbolizing wisdom and often used in clerical settings.

commodities.name: black sapphire
commodities.description: dark blue-black, opaque with a faint shine, symbolizing mystery and strength.

commodities.name: bloodstone
commodities.description: dark green with red flecks, symbolizing bravery and often used in combat magic.

commodities.name: carnelian
commodities.description: bright red-orange, translucent and glossy, often used in amulets for courage and protection.

commodities.name: chalcedony
commodities.description: smooth and waxy, often in muted colors like gray or blue, valued for its healing properties.

commodities.name: diamond
commodities.description: clear, highly reflective, with a brilliant sparkle, symbolizing purity and strength.

commodities.name: emerald
commodities.description: vivid green, transparent, and valuable, symbolizing nature and rebirth.

commodities.name: garnet
commodities.description: deep red, smooth or faceted, with a glossy surface; often used in jewelry and talismans.

commodities.name: jade
commodities.description: green, opaque, smooth and polished, symbolizing health and longevity.

commodities.name: jacinth
commodities.description: fiery orange-red, highly prized and often enchanted.

commodities.name: lapis lazuli
commodities.description: deep blue with flecks of gold pyrite, highly prized for decoration and as a symbol of royalty.

commodities.name: malachite
commodities.description: bright green with dark swirling striations, known for its intense color and use in jewelry.

commodities.name: moonstone
commodities.description: opalescent, with a shimmering blue or rainbow glow, used in divination and lunar magic.

commodities.name: obsidian
commodities.description: shiny black volcanic glass, brittle but sharp-edged, often used in primitive weaponry and decoration.

commodities.name: onyx
commodities.description: pure black or banded, with a matte to glossy finish; used in protection amulets.

commodities.name: opal
commodities.description: shimmering stone with rainbow-like hues; prized for its beauty and magical qualities.

commodities.name: pearl
commodities.description: smooth, lustrous, white or cream spheres formed in shells, symbolizing purity and used in elegant jewelry.

commodities.name: peridot
commodities.description: light green, transparent, with a glassy finish; associated with abundance and protection.

commodities.name: ruby
commodities.description: deep red, transparent, and glossy, symbolizing passion and power.

commodities.name: sapphire
commodities.description: deep blue, transparent, and reflective, symbolizing wisdom and loyalty.

commodities.name: star ruby
commodities.description: red with a shimmering star-like effect inside, prized in divination.

commodities.name: sunstone
commodities.description: sparkling orange or red with a warm glow; symbolizing vitality and energy.

commodities.name: topaz
commodities.description: clear or yellow, with a glass-like shine, symbolizing warmth and energy.

commodities.name: turquoise
commodities.description: light blue-green with dark veins, symbolizing health and protection, commonly found in warmer regions.

commodities.name: agave
commodities.description: thick green leaves with long fibers; used for coarse textiles similar to burlap.

commodities.name: bamboo
commodities.description: hollow green stalks, often split into fibers for weaving mats and textiles.

commodities.name: cotton
commodities.description: fluffy white fibers from seed pods; spun into soft, breathable fabric.

commodities.name: flax
commodities.description: soft, pale yellow fibers from stalks; spun into linen for lightweight clothing.

commodities.name: hemp
commodities.description: long, strong fibers from green stalks, durable and used for ropes and cloth.

commodities.name: jute
commodities.description: rough, yellowish-brown fibers, often used in sacks and coarse textiles.

commodities.name: nettle
commodities.description: green, fibrous stalks that are processed to remove stinging hairs; used in rustic cloth.

commodities.name: ramie
commodities.description: silky white fibers from stalks; strong and used in lightweight, fine textiles.

commodities.name: silk
commodities.description: soft, white or golden threads from silkworms; valued for its smooth, luxurious texture.

commodities.name: apples
commodities.description: red, green, or yellow, crisp and juicy; widely grown and versatile in cooking.

commodities.name: berries
commodities.description: small, juicy fruits in various colors, commonly eaten fresh.

commodities.name: cherries
commodities.description: red, round, sweet or sour, often eaten fresh or in desserts.

commodities.name: dates
commodities.description: sweet, sticky, brown fruit often dried; grown in desert regions.

commodities.name: figs
commodities.description: soft fruits with purple or green skin and sweet pink flesh.

commodities.name: grapes
commodities.description: small round berries, red, green, or purple; used fresh or for wine.

commodities.name: lemons
commodities.description: yellow, sour, used for flavoring and preservation.

commodities.name: melons
commodities.description: large fruits with juicy, sweet flesh; includes watermelons and muskmelons.

commodities.name: olives
commodities.description: small, green or black with a briny taste; eaten or pressed for oil.

commodities.name: oranges
commodities.description: bright orange, segmented fruit with a sweet-tart flavor.

commodities.name: peaches
commodities.description: soft fruits with fuzzy skin and sweet, juicy flesh.

commodities.name: pears
commodities.description: green or brown, soft and sweet; eaten fresh or preserved.

commodities.name: plums
commodities.description: dark purple or red with a juicy flesh; eaten fresh or dried as prunes.

commodities.name: pomegranates
commodities.description: round, red fruits with juicy seeds inside.

commodities.name: quince
commodities.description: yellow, hard, and fragrant; often cooked or used in preserves.

commodities.name: abyssal glass
commodities.description: dark and slightly translucent, with a smoky appearance and faint magical shimmer, often associated with infernal artifacts.

commodities.name: amber
commodities.description: golden-brown and semi-transparent, sometimes with trapped organic material, prized for its warm, resinous appearance.

commodities.name: crystal ice
commodities.description: clear and glass-like, often with intricate frost patterns; resistant to melting and used in magical crafting.

commodities.name: darkglass
commodities.description: smoky black with a dull shine, commonly used in enchanted mirrors and to obscure light or vision.

commodities.name: dlarun
commodities.description: pale blue with a frosty sheen, cool to the touch and sometimes polished to a glass-like finish.

commodities.name: obsidian
commodities.description: glossy, black volcanic glass, brittle but razor-sharp, often used for primitive tools and weapons.

commodities.name: sandglass
commodities.description: pale, rough-textured glass with a faint sandy sheen, durable and resistant to extreme heat and cold.

commodities.name: adamantine
commodities.description: dark and nearly black, with impressive density and durability, often forged into weapons meant to last ages.

commodities.name: arandur
commodities.description: deep, reflective blue with a striking metallic quality, known for its anti-scrying and anti-teleportation properties.

commodities.name: baatorian greensteel
commodities.description: dark, sinister green with a near-black undertone and a wickedly sharp edge, favored in infernal weaponry.

commodities.name: bloodstone
commodities.description: dark red mineral that appears as though stained with blood, rumored to resonate with battle energies.

commodities.name: copper
commodities.description: reddish-brown metal with a warm glow, develops a green patina over time, making it popular for decorative uses.

commodities.name: dlarun
commodities.description: pale blue metal with a frosty sheen that feels cool to the touch, known for its resistance to heat.

commodities.name: gold
commodities.description: lustrous, vibrant yellow, soft yet dense; a symbol of wealth and often used in magical artifacts.

commodities.name: iron
commodities.description: dark gray metal with a rugged, matte finish, often developing a reddish rust; strong but prone to corrosion when exposed to moisture.

commodities.name: mithral
commodities.description: silvery-blue and incredibly lightweight; valued for its resilience and often found in the finest, most agile armors.

commodities.name: silver
commodities.description: bright, reflective, and malleable; its polished surface captures light beautifully, often used in coinage and jewelry.

commodities.name: tears of selûne
commodities.description: silvery-white with a soft, glowing quality, as if touched by moonlight; often associated with holy relics.

commodities.name: tin
commodities.description: silvery-gray and soft, with a subtle shine; usually alloyed with copper to create more durable bronze.

commodities.name: meteoric iron
commodities.description: dark gray, slightly magnetic with tiny embedded crystals, rumored to fall from the heavens and hold anti-magic properties.

commodities.name: belladonna
commodities.description: dark green leaves and purple-black berries; highly toxic, used in poisons and medicine.

commodities.name: bitterleaf
commodities.description: jagged green leaves with a sharp, bitter taste; sometimes used in herbal remedies.

commodities.name: bloodroot
commodities.description: red-stained root with small white flowers; used to stop bleeding and heal wounds.

commodities.name: fireflower
commodities.description: vibrant red petals with flame-like tips; used in potions to resist fire.

commodities.name: gallowleaf
commodities.description: twisted dark leaves with supernatural associations; used in necromantic potions.

commodities.name: goldenstar
commodities.description: bright yellow, star-shaped flowers; symbolizing luck and used in enchantments.

commodities.name: moonflower
commodities.description: white flower that opens at night with a faint glow; often used in calming potions.

commodities.name: nightshade
commodities.description: glossy leaves with purple flowers and black berries; dangerous and often used in alchemy.

commodities.name: silverthorn
commodities.description: silver-green leaves with small thorns; used for its medicinal properties against infections.

commodities.name: sunberry
commodities.description: small, bright yellow berries with a tart taste; used in potions for vitality.

commodities.name: wyrmtongue
commodities.description: long, slender golden petals; often used in wards against dragons.

commodities.name: alabaster
commodities.description: creamy white, fine-grained and slightly translucent, valued for carving and decoration.

commodities.name: basalt
commodities.description: dark, dense volcanic stone with a smooth finish, often used in defensive structures due to its durability.

commodities.name: darkstone
commodities.description: jet black, absorbs light, and is cool to the touch; often used in stealth or concealment areas.

commodities.name: granite
commodities.description: gray or pink speckled stone, very hard and often polished to a glossy finish, prized for durability in fortifications.

commodities.name: limestone
commodities.description: soft, beige or pale gray with a slightly rough surface, easily carved, often used in building.

commodities.name: marble
commodities.description: white with gray or colored veins, smooth and polished, known for its beauty and use in temples and statues.

commodities.name: sandstone
commodities.description: light brown or yellowish, with a grainy texture and natural layers, common in warmer climates.

commodities.name: anise
commodities.description: star-shaped pods with a licorice flavor; used in desserts and beverages.

commodities.name: bay leaves
commodities.description: smooth, oval green leaves with a mild aroma; often used to flavor stews and soups.

commodities.name: black pepper
commodities.description: small, wrinkled black spheres with a sharp heat; a staple spice in many regions.

commodities.name: cardamom
commodities.description: small, green pods with aromatic seeds; valued in sweet and savory dishes.

commodities.name: cinnamon
commodities.description: fragrant brown bark rolled into sticks; used in sweet and savory dishes.

commodities.name: clove
commodities.description: dried flower buds, dark brown, with a strong aroma; used to flavor meats and sauces.

commodities.name: coriander
commodities.description: small, round yellowish-brown seeds with a citrusy taste; used in various cuisines.

commodities.name: fennel
commodities.description: green, feathery leaves and small seeds with a sweet, anise-like flavor.

commodities.name: fenugreek
commodities.description: yellow-brown seeds with a slightly bitter, nutty flavor; used in sauces and medicine.

commodities.name: firepepper
commodities.description: small, fiery red pods; used to add heat to dishes, especially in southern regions.

commodities.name: galangal
commodities.description: light brown, fibrous root with a peppery, ginger-like flavor; common in Eastern cuisine.

commodities.name: ginger
commodities.description: knobby brown root with a warm, spicy flavor; used in cooking and healing.

commodities.name: koraa nut
commodities.description: small, reddish-brown nut with a bitter taste; used in Mulhorandi cuisine.

commodities.name: mace
commodities.description: thin, red outer layer of the nutmeg seed; used for its slightly sweet flavor.

commodities.name: mustard seeds
commodities.description: tiny, round seeds, yellow or brown, with a strong flavor when ground; common in cooking.

commodities.name: nutmeg
commodities.description: round, brown seed often grated for its sweet, spicy aroma; used in desserts.

commodities.name: saffron
commodities.description: delicate red threads with a rich, floral aroma; highly prized and valuable.

commodities.name: sumac
commodities.description: deep red powder with a tangy, lemony taste; popular in Middle Eastern dishes.

commodities.name: thesk spice
commodities.description: an exotic, varied blend of spices with a rich aroma, popular in high-end dishes.

commodities.name: turmeric
commodities.description: bright yellow root with an earthy flavor; used in cooking and as a dye.

commodities.name: wyrmtongue
commodities.description: a golden-yellow spice with a slight shimmer, used in potions and protective wards.

commodities.name: ash
commodities.description: grayish bark with a tall, straight trunk; known for resilience and used in tool handles and weapon shafts.

commodities.name: birch
commodities.description: white bark with delicate, papery layers; its wood is soft and often used in furniture.

commodities.name: blueleaf
commodities.description: blue-tinted leaves, often found in magical groves; lightweight wood used by rangers and druids.

commodities.name: cedar
commodities.description: fragrant reddish wood with natural insect resistance; used for building and storage chests.

commodities.name: chime oak
commodities.description: musical bark that produces gentle tones when wind moves through it; valued for its enchanting properties.

commodities.name: darkwood
commodities.description: lightweight, dark, and magically resistant; used in ranger and druid equipment.

commodities.name: ebony
commodities.description: dark black or brown wood, dense and fine-grained; prized for its luxurious appearance.

commodities.name: ironwood
commodities.description: dense and extremely tough wood; often used for reinforced buildings and armor.

commodities.name: mahogany
commodities.description: deep reddish-brown wood with a smooth grain; prized for fine furniture and carving.

commodities.name: maple
commodities.description: smooth gray bark with broad leaves that turn red or yellow; valued for syrup and hardwood.

commodities.name: oak
commodities.description: strong, wide trunk with thick, deeply ridged bark; valued for its hardwood in furniture and building.

commodities.name: pine
commodities.description: tall and evergreen with needle-like leaves, producing cones; valued for its softwood, used in construction and fuel.

commodities.name: rosewood
commodities.description: rich reddish-brown with dark streaks, often fragrant; valued in furniture and musical instruments.

commodities.name: shadowtop
commodities.description: tall with a broad canopy and dark bark; known for its durability and used in building.

commodities.name: silverbark
commodities.description: silvery sheen with a flexible texture; used in bows and armor among elven communities.

commodities.name: teak
commodities.description: golden-brown, weather-resistant wood; used in shipbuilding and outdoor furniture.

commodities.name: walnut
commodities.description: dark brown wood, with rough, furrowed bark; prized for its strength and beauty in carpentry.

commodities.name: weirwood
commodities.description: pale, rot-resistant wood, favored in magical crafting for its longevity.

commodities.name: yew
commodities.description: dark green needles and reddish bark, often associated with bows due to its elasticity and strength.

commodities.name: zalantar
commodities.description: black-barked tree, resistant to moisture; often called blackwood, valued in weapon crafting.

commodities.name: beans
commodities.description: green or dried pods with seeds, used in a variety of dishes.

commodities.name: cabbage
commodities.description: round, leafy green heads; a common vegetable in soups and stews.

commodities.name: carrots
commodities.description: orange, tapered roots with a sweet flavor; versatile and widely used.

commodities.name: celery
commodities.description: crunchy, pale green stalks, often used in soups and stews.

commodities.name: kale
commodities.description: curly or flat, green leaves, often used in hearty dishes.

commodities.name: leeks
commodities.description: long, thick green stalks with a mild onion flavor.

commodities.name: onions
commodities.description: brown, red, or white bulbs with a strong flavor; used to season dishes.

commodities.name: parsnips
commodities.description: creamy white, carrot-like roots with a slightly sweet flavor.

commodities.name: peas
commodities.description: round green seeds in pods, used fresh or dried in cooking.

commodities.name: potatoes
commodities.description: brown, knobbly tubers; a filling staple in many regions.

commodities.name: pumpkins
commodities.description: large orange gourds with thick flesh; cooked in soups and desserts.

commodities.name: radishes
commodities.description: small, red or white, round and spicy; eaten raw or in salads.

commodities.name: spinach
commodities.description: dark green leafy vegetable, eaten raw or cooked.

commodities.name: squash
commodities.description: hard shell with orange or green flesh; often used in soups and baked dishes.

commodities.name: turnips
commodities.description: purple-white bulbs with leafy tops; hearty and mild, used in stews.
